byline.original: By GEETA ANAND and HARI KUMAR

abstract: Indian Prime Min Narendra Modi's surprise ban on both 500-rupee and 1,000-rupee bills has upended country's informal cash-based economic sector, which makes up 20 percent of country's gross domestic product and 80 percent of its employment; Modi administration hopes measure will discourage hoarding cash, increase tax revenues and lift economy, but businesses are finding it difficult to adapt.
lead_paragraph: When Prime Minister Narendra Modi banned the 500- and 1,000-rupee bills, his goal was to spur the economy. But the move seems to be having the opposite effect.
snippet: When Prime Minister Narendra Modi banned the 500- and 1,000-rupee bills, his goal was to spur the economy. But the move seems to be having the opposite effect....

headline.main: Indian Vendors See Empty Stores and Blame a Rupee Ban
headline.print_headline: With Stores Empty, Vendors in India Blame a Rupee Ban
